intro: Eugenia balancanensis, commonly known as the Balancan guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and red, edible berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface. The fruit is often used in local cuisine and traditional medicine due to its unique flavor and nutritional value.
